messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re:Dismemberment
messages.msgSnippet: ***He took all the little Lego people, removed their heads and placed them in the Viking ship ***  Dylan s been lobbing little Lego heads from his catapult
messages.messageBody:
***He took all the little Lego people, removed their heads and placed
them in the Viking
ship ***

<G> Dylan's been lobbing little Lego heads from his catapult since he saw
Return of the King. "Release the prisoners!"

Deb L

messages.subject: Re:Dismemberment
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/2/2004 10:59:50 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... fault. ... My boys have that,but it is displayed through barbie dolls and actions figures.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/2/2004 10:59:50 PM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
> It's called ODD (obsessive dismemberment disorder) and it's not my
fault.
>
>
>>>

My boys have that,but it is displayed through barbie dolls and
actions figures. I have a GI Joe here at the computer who has lost
his legs and one hand.
*************************
Just spent the last few days at my best friend's house. She has a 5 year old,
Liam, who for Christmas got all his 14 year old brother's old Legos. He took
all the little Lego people, removed their heads and placed them in the Viking
ship he got. Then he put the torsos in a little plastic container.

We suggested that they start the counseling now so they cover their bases for
when they get sued later.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re:Dismemberment
messages.msgSnippet: Just spent the last few days at my best friend s house. She has a 5 year old, ... took ... Viking ... for ... ROFLOL We were planning my wedding. My uncle was
messages.messageBody:
Just spent the last few days at my best friend's house. She has a 5 year
old,
> Liam, who for Christmas got all his 14 year old brother's old Legos. He
took
> all the little Lego people, removed their heads and placed them in the
Viking
> ship he got. Then he put the torsos in a little plastic container.
>
> We suggested that they start the counseling now so they cover their bases
for
> when they get sued later.
>
> Kathryn
ROFLOL

We were planning my wedding. My uncle was doing the ceremony. My cousins,
both girls, were just 3 and 5 1/2. The 5 yo asked if they could pop the
balloons we had for them to play with. Her sister pipes up, "let's twist
them into people first, THEN pop them!" It did make us all take note and
wonder ... LOL

Barbara

Barbara Moreda
